thread.title: NLDS Game 1: Mets at Dodgers, Friday, 6:45 p.m.
thread.title_full: NLDS Game 1: Mets at Dodgers, Friday, 6:45 p.m. - Press Enterprise

author: BILL PLUNKETT
title: NLDS Game 1: Mets at Dodgers, Friday, 6:45 p.m.
text:
By BILL PLUNKETT / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 8, 2015 Updated: 6:50 p.m. Where: Dodger Stadium
TV: TBS, 6:45 p.m.
Did you know: The Dodgers and Mets have met in the postseason twice. The Dodgers won in seven games in the 1988 NLCS, and the Mets swept three games in the 2006 NLDS.
THE PITCHERS
LHP CLAYTON KERSHAW (16-7, 2.13)
Kershaw led the majors in strikeouts (301) and innings pitched (2322/3) and went 11-1 with a 1.22 ERA since July 1. But he has lost his past four playoff starts with an ERA of 7.15.
Vs. Mets: 6-0, 1.34
At Dodger Stadium: 63-28, 2.07
RHP JACOB deGROM (14-8, 2.54)
The least-heralded of the Metsâ€™ young pitchers, deGrom emerged as the best of the bunch this season, leading the team in wins (tied with Bartolo Colon), ERA, strikeouts (205) and WHIP (0.98). His 191 innings were a career-high, however, and deGrom seemed to show signs of fatigue down the stretch. He had a 4.91 ERA and .285 batting average against in his last seven starts.
Vs. Dodgers: 0-2, 3.66
At Dodger Stadium: 0-1, 7.50
Contact the writer: bplunkett@ocregister.com
